intro: Gymnadenia anisoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that bear whorled, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers in late summer, which are typically arranged in a loose, racemose inflorescence. It is native to Europe and prefers moist, calcareous soils in grassy habitats. Gymnadenia anisoloba is often found in meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
